Within without.

"Now that's the Chandra I've been waiting to see." —Liliana Vess

Born of the core, and dying to stoke it.

Many airship captains keep pets that share their love of the sky.

The Ghitu of Shiv are as fierce and uncompromising as their volcanic home.

Going down with the ship is just the beginning.

Mercadians not wealthy enough to buy a tomb are thrown into a bog called "the Ghoul's Larder."
It once served a cathar roadwatcher, patrolling the crossways between villages. Its hooves still carry it along the same path.
It uproots entire fengrafs to add to its twisted frame.
"To a creature like that, we must seem like, well, bugs." —Dars Gostok, Firefist captain
It waits with absolute stillness. One might think it a statue if it weren't occasionally seen chewing on its victims.
Disturb a sleeping badger and the snapping of your bones will awaken the countryside.
"'I've seen hornworms big as a man's fist,' the traveler said, and nodded soberly when our jaws went slack at his ignorance." —Afari, Tales

Its sting hurts, but death is strangely painless.
The only feeling greater than hurling something a mile is crushing something else with it that was really, really irritating you.
"If you'd ever met one, you wouldn't ask me to justify the extra provisions for additional security." —Lorref, caravan master
The giant-decorating contest at the migration festival is a tradition that may have started as a dare.

"Crovax seems filled only with shadows," thought Orim. "Where does his strength come from?"
In the coastal states of Jhess and Valeron, "tortoise" is a synonym for "stubborn."
"So large and so quiet—a combination best avoided." —Disa the Restless, journal entry
"The turtle lives 'twixt plated decks/ Which practically conceal its sex./ I think it clever of the turtle/ In such a fix to be so fertile." —Ogden Nash, "The Turtle"
"When the Ancestor saw the cruelty her human children were capable of, Her fury shook the world. From this outburst sprang the warthogs." —Nomad myth
Hyenas laughing—what's the joke? —Femeref phrase meaning "that's not funny"
"The good don't sit and wait for the evil to act. They prepare to defend. They prepare to punish."

"The essence of a lawful society is swift deterrence."

The blessing adds both protection to the recipient and weightlessness to the stone.

Merchants of the Underworld trade in coins of clay. Gold serves another purpose.
The plating of its horns is a token of honor from Hazoret, who favors creatures with great hearts.
Buyer beware.
"Whoever survives the first blow lives to land the second."
"The perfection of the lotus reminds me of my hopes for this world . . . and my failures. I will not rest until I've atoned for them." —Karn
The River Heralds fight to keep all others from reaching the golden city. The city has its own defenses.
Do the glowing trinkets show it the way home, or do they set a twisted path for someone else to follow?
"The only gold I need is the sheltering shimmer of the trees."
"In our hands, the natural world finds more beauty than nature alone could ever provide."
Dawn's Light, greatest palace of Gilt-Leaf Wood, is built on tiers of wood and power.
Desmera blinded her seers so that her beauty would be the last image burned in their memories. The act only deepened their insight.
"To trespass so far from home is to ask for a lonesome grave."

"These fiends are slightly less tolerable than you." "A sentiment that warms my heart, sister."

"Get behind me!"

Its wings produce a high-pitched, barely audible whirring sound in flight. Only Jeskai masters are quiet enough to hear one coming.

The giants believe the fossils they find in Lorwyn's rocky heights are dreams frozen in time, and they treasure them.

"Do not react to force in kind. Turn it aside. Direct it to where it can do no harm." —Meloku the Clouded Mirror
Centuries of careful practice have elevated the casting of protective spells to an art form. What little offensive magic remains on Bant stands little chance of breaching them.
"Woodlands and laws. Both grow faster than the Azorius's ability to manage them." —Suniel the Woodwise

He tried to live far from those he could hurt . . .
. . . but the monster within was a tireless hunter.

He collects the precious metals, and then converts the rest to propellant.
"The creature we fought in the western waste was doubly dangerous: mortally wounded, it rebounded and attacked again." —Disa the Restless, journal entry

The embodiment of yearning, forever drifting the deserts to find what had once made it whole.

Don't stand in his way, for his way is full of pointy things and fire.

Few entrances lead to where demons and devils lurk. Unfortunately, they occasionally open new ones.

"Here."

Expeditionary houses are notorious for their rivalries. But when adventurers meet in the wilderness, the instinct for mutual survival outweighs petty grudges.

"What need have I for cavalry when I can have horse and rider both in one?" —Jolrael
"War destroys; nature renews." —Jolrael, empress of beasts

. . . but every end is a new beginning.

"Today, for a lark, let's visit the plains. I'm sure we'll find something to entertain us."

"I have been gifted by the kami with long life. So far, they have not seen fit to withdraw their gift. There may yet be a way to stop the killing without more blood, human or kami, being spilled." —Dosan the Falling Leaf
chitty-chitty-BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG!

Broad as a baobab—and about as smart.

"It's time to put the 'die' in 'diameter!'" —Flaky the Irrational

When it's finished, all that's left of you is a ripple on a still pond.

As sharp as its bearer's words of faith.
